p: Our study provides the first estimate of influenza-associated mortality in the Philippines. The countryâ€™s influenza-associated EMR was considerable between 2006 and 2015: an estimated 5.09 influenza-attributable deaths occurred per 100,000 persons each year, and influenza was the cause of approximately one in every 100 deaths. A disproportionate percentage of influenza-attributable excess deaths (67.1%) occurred among individuals aged 60 years or older, considering that this age group represented just 7% of the total population [ 22].
